title: A Disinfectant That’s More Powerful Than Bleach—And Safe for Your Skin
description: Hypochlorous acid is a promising disinfectant that is difficult to commercialize because it is not very shelf-stable. Senior features editor Jen Schwartz takes us through what the science of this nontoxic disinfectant is and explains why its popularity in the beauty aisle is only the beginning.  Recommended reading:  The Nontoxic Cleaner That Kills Germs Better Than Bleach—And You Can Use It on Your Skin https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/hypochlorous-acid-is-trending-in-skin-care-and-cleaning-but-does-it-work/  E-mail us at sciencequickly@sciam.com if you have any questions, comments or ideas for stories we should cover!
